text: <@U08C22VNW|mhouston> has joined the channel

purpose: Discuss the p2p aspects of the platform, to take it out of band from the general discussion.
text: <@U08C22VNW|mhouston> set the channel purpose: Discuss the p2p aspects of the platform, to take it out of band from the general discussion.
<@U08E5P0BZ>: Re: PeerJS - definitely a great place to start. As a layer on top of WebRTC it works really well, but still needs a central registry server to establish handshakes.
<@U08E5P0BZ|georgevaccaro> has joined the channel
I was looking at the source code a while back, and it should be possible to replace (or augment) the central server with a DHT-based handshake if you know the ID of the node you want to connect to.
<@U08D641AP|martindale> has joined the channel
<@U08C9ML1Y|chiguireitor> has joined the channel
Priming of the peers database will always need a central server, but you could then begin globbing peers and stop relying on the central servers afterwards
why not pre-bake a known set of good peers into every release?
that could work, but what would qualify a "good" peer
node health, uptime
available connection "ports"
top 32 peers with the longest-lasting payment channel
like bitcoin does on the amount of simultaneous connected peers?
ayup
it would be nice if a node could be query'd for available connections
definitely, but note that they can lie
indeed...
how to cope with that
<@U08F1FZE2|jgerber> has joined the channel
<@U08ERPTQF|paul_xbt> has joined the channel
could the peerid be the user's public address, which is evident from the blockchain transaction that 'registered' the content by it's hash?
just uncovered this earlier post about <https://github.com/tradle/tim> - interesting P2P work <https://dattnetwork.slack.com/archives/general/p1438371019001045>

attachments.title: tradle/tim
attachments.text: tim - p2p chat with OTR and externalization to blockchain+dht

attachments.fallback: [July 31st, 2015 12:30 PM] genevayngrib: <@U08E5P0BZ>: my team Tradle is deep into identity on-chain, I need to step out, but will be happy to share more later in the evening. Meanwhile here is link to our project, that is using identity as a foundational block for real-time and persistent messaging <https://github.com/tradle/tim> This could work for reddit-like DMs, and more
